articles.title: EA will skip next year’s F1 game and release update DLC instead - The Verge
articles.description: EA is planning to release a downloadable paid expansion update for F1 25 instead of releasing a full new game next year, with a “full” refreshed experience coming in 2027.

articles.title: Goodbye, ‘Halo Infinite’ (2021-2025) - Gizmodo
articles.description: Despite the odds being stacked against it and a rough launch, 'Halo Infinite' grew into its own good thing over time.

articles.title: Megabonk Developer Withdraws Game From The Game Awards, Saying It Doesn't Qualify for Debut Indie - IGN
articles.description: Vedinad, developer of Megabonk, has withdrawn his game from The Game Awards following its nomination for Best Debut Indie Game, saying it doesn't qualify for the category.

articles.title: Google Pulls Down AI Chatbot After It Accuses Senator of Terrible Crime - Futurism
articles.description: Google pulled the Gemma model from its AI Hub after the AI falsely claimed that a Republican senator had been accused of heinous crimes.

articles.title: Microsoft to integrate Sysmon directly into Windows 11, Server 2025 - BleepingComputer
articles.description: Microsoft announced today that it will integrate Sysmon natively into Windows 11 and Windows Server 2025 next year, making it unnecessary to deploy the standalone Sysinternals tools.
